website_summaries.verdict: Helps you treat very bad spot areas without covering the whole floor.
pros: A good value for helping very troubled areas of your hardwood floors without having to strip and refinish
cons: You need to make sure you are purchasing the right color or tone for the best result

customer_reviews.title: A miracle product, for realz
customer_reviews.text: Dull wood, scuffs, water damaged wood, cr@p you bought off Craigslist for $10... This will make it all look FOINE👌 Pro tip: don't fuss about the color too much. It won't look off even if the shade isn't exactly right, as this is only very lightly tinted. If the wood is in really bad shape, here's what you do: 1) sand lightly with 0000 steel wool 2) apply this stuff with a rag and let it sit overnight 3) apply a wax, such as beeswax and buff
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Renee

customer_reviews.title: Literally Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING! I will absolutely use it again in the future. We inherited a dining set from the 1940s and it was heavily damaged from years of canning on it's surface. With some sanding and this finish it's almost like new! The product increases the color of the wood and erases scratches!
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Huneycutt

customer_reviews.title: Works Miracles!
customer_reviews.text: This worked crazy miracles for a cherished family heirloom coffee table that came to us beat up after nieces had mistreated it with water marks, heat marks, scratches going against the grain from improper cleaning an then later a nephew knocked a glass of red wine over it and it bleached the wood horribly. We almost got it professionally refinished which would have been a shame to lose the original finish. So, glad we didn't! This product restored it back to almost perfect condition. On the really bad areas I concentrated my scrubbing until looked as best I could get it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Greetham

customer_reviews.title: Improved the look of my 25+ year old builders grad cabinets so much I will not replace them!
customer_reviews.text: I found a video on Youtube discussing how to use this product so I decided to see how much it improved the appearance of my 25+ year old cabinets. I was amazed at how they turned out! They looked so good when I finished that I decided not to replace them! This saved me lots and lots of money! The Golden Oak color was an excellent match for the builders grade Honey Oak color in my kitchen! I am very pleased with my purchase! The picture is of my sink cabinet when I was done and it was in the worse condition!
customer_reviews.author: M. Edelblute

customer_reviews.title: don't understand all the good reviews and you can't return.  Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product, nothing as advertised, the dark walnut is NOT dark at all - I am seriously questioning these "miraculous" pictures. The neutral is dark and didn't work on the light wood and the dark walnut was like putting nothing on the ring. These are going back - absolutely not as advertised. So hahahah Amazon can ship you flammable products but you CANNOT return flammable products. What a joke - waste of $20.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: This product is not what I expected. I followed the instructions to the T, and it does work for about an hour then it dries and the wood goes back to what it was. Then at the bottom of the instructions it says to use wax if you want it to stay longer. At this point you might as well sand it and paint it again. I even tried calling their number on the amazon and it goes to a deadline. I contacted Amazon and they took care of it. So 5 stars for amazon, should be no stars for these guys
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "SNAKE OIL" DOES NOT WORK, BOGUS MERCHANDISE
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your monies on this, it does not work at all you can get same result from regular pledge if you just want a oily surface. Its very messy but more than that it's useless and then says s use a wool pad if it doesn't work all that did was destroy the surface of my table. All I wanted to do was to cover up a water circle.
customer_reviews.author: Tehrunee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: It looks like you slapped grease on your furniture. It didn’t cover anything. I accidentally spilled nail polish remover and it caused this big stain. I read in the comments that it would help cover a stain but it didn’t help at all. Just made my table look worse.I could not get a refund because the item is flammable so returns are not available. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Black magic in a small can
customer_reviews.text: We found a wonderful mid century cabinet and bookcase at a local second-hand store. It was beat to hell but we bought it because we loved the scale and shape. We cleaned it with Murphy's Oil Soap, then gave it a good coat of this amazing substance. It instantly changed the appearance of the piece. We finished with a coat of Howard's Feed and Wax for good measure, but it was this stuff that brought it back to life. I wish I had a before photo, but here is the after...
customer_reviews.author: Halophonic

customer_reviews.title: I love all the Howards products
customer_reviews.text: I love all the Howards products. I did use this color Mahogany on a vintage sewing machine cabinet made by Singer, that I won in a live auction recently. Like other reviewers have stated, it does require some "elbow grease" & "sweat" , & sometimes a quadruple ot, or 0000 steel wool for areas with the most damage. I will forever be a Howards products fan, for all my vintage wooden pieces. Oh, I do also use the "Feed-N-Wax" product after. :)
customer_reviews.author: Maria Marko

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work as stated
customer_reviews.text: Looks dark, but once dried no change at all, followed instruction 100%, , it did not work.... tried to return but sadly tis is not returnable, I wish can rate it 0 star......
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I loved how easy this was to use. It made a huge difference in the appearance of my old wood trim and antique kitchen cabinets. A little goes a long ways too. I plan on buying more in a darker stain to go over some beat up paneling in one room too.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Wow does this work well
customer_reviews.text: This stuff saved me the $5,000 it would have cost to replace or refinish my kitchen cabinets. It was very easy to apply (I just used an old rag) and it virtually erased 20 years of wear and tear. Small scrapes, cracks in the original finish, and even places where the finish had worn off completely -- all gone like magic. The only caution is to be sure to lots of fresh air ventilation while you're working with this, otherwise you'll get seriously dizzy in a few minutes from the volatile fumes. Also, don't use the kitchen burners or have any other flames on nearby while working with this, otherwise you might blow up your house!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Had mixed results - did not restore but left a nice shine. Basically furniture polish
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on two pieces of furniture. One piece was an antique solid walnut table that had some minor discoloration where a doily had sat for some time. It did nothing to even the finish - made the dark areas a little more noticeable and did nothing to the faded spots. I have a Pottery Barn desk that had some scratches from my cats running across it. It did help with that. It also left a nice shine that wasn't greasy. I will continue to use it on my other furniture but need to find something to restore my antique table.
customer_reviews.author: Shiva

customer_reviews.title: Great results with less effort than expected
customer_reviews.text: 40+ yo grimy, soiled, partially stripped, dog-scratched oak kitchen cabinets came with the house. LOTs of chemicals and elbow grease for cleaning were followed by Restore-a-finish in Cherry. Love it. Deeper scratches are still there of course, but virtually all discolorations, small scratches are gone with a dramatically improved color and texture. Had to do 3 rub-ins with 0000 steel wool, however, and it took 5 cans for the entire kitchen (lots of cabinets top and bottom). A year for cleaning, 1 day of Restore.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Old table looks great now
customer_reviews.text: I bought a sturdy little end table for next to nothing today. The finish was terrible and no one wanted it. I had some Restor-a-Finish left over from my last project, so I bought the table. It took me less than five minutes to get it looking nice. It’s perfect for my family room now. I really love Howard products for their excellent results.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick - and very well
customer_reviews.text: This worked extremely well on a furniture restoration project. It even hid some very conspicuous light spots on the wood when rubbed in with the recommended steel wool. (I used 3M synthetic steel wool, which did the trick and did not fall apart quickly like regular steel wool.)
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: it is absolutely the best I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've done painting for over 50 years. When it comes to this product, it is absolutely the best I've ever used. The baseboards, doors and woodwork in my house looked awful...at least by my standards. Before I applied the product, I sanded the rough spots with 100 grit sandpaper and then did a light wet sanding with 220 paper over the entire board. I was amazed when I applied the product...it made the boards look new!
customer_reviews.author: freebuckweaver

customer_reviews.title: Miraculous!- but get the right color!
customer_reviews.text: We recently sold our 1950s home and wanted to freshen up all the woodwork first. This product is hands down miraculous and does what everyone says it will do. However - if you are buffing out scratches, you need to get the lightest shade possible. Otherwise the pigment will settle into the scratch and make it look darker. For watermarks or other superficial issues, match the color. But for scratches, go lighter.
customer_reviews.author: krisalicious

customer_reviews.title: Made the damage worse
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened. This product made the damaged area of the wood dresser worse. Now there's a white haze over the damaged area that was not there before. I bought their wax and have put it over the haze repeatedly and it does not remove it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mcfadden

customer_reviews.title: terrific product
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time to try this product, but it seems to get good reviews and is carried by many antique and architectural salvage stores, so decided to give it a try. I must say that it matched well (wide array of colors available, choose carefully by going online to compare available colors with item to be refinished) and blends very well. I used it to refinish an area of some cabinets that my tenants had damaged by getting water on them, bleaching the finish (no idea how they did that!). Could not have come out better. I have a lot of experience refinishing woodword and am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley K

customer_reviews.title: I tried applying to my great grandmothers kitchen table that I inherited and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well on faded woods with some water spots and light scratches. I applied to an old bathroom vanity in my apartment and it definitely brightened it. I tried applying to my great grandmothers kitchen table that I inherited and it was definitely far too gone for this product. It will need to be completely refinished. However, for the bathroom vanity it worked great and I plan on doing the kitchen cabinets in my apartment as well. A great low investment way to make my rental look better
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: OMG!! Just buy this already!!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to pay someone to refinish your floors, use this! This product is amazing. Follow the instructions by using steel wool to apply this, then after 30 minutes wipe the excess up. I then add the Feed-N-Wax product with a cloth, then 30 minutes wipe the excess up. Your floors will look brand new!! My cat had pretty much ruined one of the bedroom floors by peeing on a run while we were at work. I was so pissed, I had been looking for a solution that didn't require me to pay an arm and a leg to have someone refinish it. This product took those stains away and the floor looks brand new!!
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle - but OK
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I had high hopes for this stuff. My coffee table had some scratches and white heat stains. I used as instructed and the table's appearance has improved by only 5-10%. Table doesn't look any better than when I use a regular orange oil polish. The heat stains are still there and the scratches are still quite visible I didn't expect my table to look new again, but I did expect the product to fulfill at least some of it's claims. I am rather disappointed and feel like I am being generous to give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Reesee

customer_reviews.title: Brought the table back to life
customer_reviews.text: I have a midcentury style wood side table that has seen better days. The top wood is slightly warped, there are a couple water stains and the finish is almost completely off, as well as scratches and scuffs all over. I purchased this along with the beeswax feed and conditioner and there is a very noticeable difference. It's not perfect. It didn't take away the water stains. However it covered the scratches and gave a fresh coat of color to the top and all the places where the finish is rubbed away. Next I'm going to try it on a 1920s blanket chest with scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stuff. The only drawback was it isn't poly-based ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to purchase this product at an antique store years ago and the container lasted about ten years. Wonderful stuff. The only drawback was it isn't poly-based and so you have to watch for watermarks, etc. But the old wood drank it up and turned into beautiful, deep, glowing wood.
customer_reviews.author: Cerulean Artist

customer_reviews.title: Miracle in a can
customer_reviews.text: I am so fussy about my apartment but despise hard labor which for me includes prep work. I applied this with 0000 Steele wool and it turned the most dull and damaged wood new and beautiful. It cleans up with soap and water. It is AMAZING. Next little mice and birds will be making me dresses. Buy this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Thunder

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed at all
customer_reviews.text: There’s no way the reviews here are legit. I put this on my coffee table, (it’s a very thin liquid, like water actually) initially the table looked great, but when I returned to the table an hour later, the table looked untouched. What a rip off. The smell is a very strong turpentine type of odor. This stuff is like colored water, does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great product ideal for white rings
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! I emailed initially this company and got recommendations from the owner (thank you Howard!!) after seeing pictures of my table. I had a white ring on my mango wood table and the table is now like new. I use steel wood 0000 to apply the product, wiped with a soft clothe and finished it with Feed-N-Wax 30min later. The product blends in completely the color of the wood. The white ring was darker before drying so you just have to wait for a couple of hours before seeing the final result. Here' the before/after pictures. The table appears whiter on the first picture because of the lighting when I took it.
customer_reviews.author: Virginie Prevot

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! EASY TO USE!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely an amazing product! I had Acetone put on my kitchen table (by a cotton ball) and I used this and it helped a lot. Unfortunately for me, I scrapped the acetone with my nail so it did put gouges in the wood, but this product helped tremendously to obtain the color back. I also used it on a side table with water markings and it took the water marks completely away. Very easy to use! I'm sure if I sand that small area of the kitchen table and use this , it would probably appear as if it never happened :)
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great Option for making your furniture look its best!
customer_reviews.text: Howard's Restor a Finish is an excellent product. Much of our furniture is antique or near antique. The Restor a Finish works wonders with a wide diversity of finishes and sheens. The Beeswax product and oil products all work together very well. I am restoring the finish to our entire kitchen cabinet set. So far the results are just outstanding. I did the first cabinet restoration nearly a month ago. The cabinets still look great. They have excellent how-to videos on You Tube. I have used three different tints on different projects. They all work so nice its hard to believe. No I don't work for them, but maybe I should?
customer_reviews.author: JamesR_in_SLC

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get rid of white rings - just made surface oily...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this product to work! I wanted to love it... Sadly it did not work at all in my case. No matter how much of it I applied or how hard I worked it in with super fine steel wool. The white water spot that I was working on did not wane out of existence as advertised or even diminish at all and is still staring back at me insolently, although maybe slightly more polished and slick. The whole surface (wood table) became quite oily after the application - not what I was expecting at all. Perhaps your mileage will vary. Sadly, for me though - its a dud!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Someone recommended this product to remove white water stains from a table. I was skeptical, but thought what have I got to lose as we had a large watermark staring at us from our dinning room table. I bought two colors because I wasn't certain of which would be a better match. Turns out it was cherry. I was skeptical yet again when the instructions said to use #0000 steel wool, but I followed the instructions and was completely blown away when the ugly water mark was completely removed! This product worked great and I'd happily recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick W

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, it is quite red
customer_reviews.text: I bought a water damaged, antique table at an estate sale. I tried all other remedies. This worked only after I added lacquer thinner to it. (about 1/4 lacquer thinner and 3/4 Restore-A-Finish) Try the product alone first. I had serious water damage and was amazed that I didn't have to refinish the whole table. I would have chosen a less red color if I had known it was so red. It's pretty but my husband thought it was too red. I was just excited that it worked so well. After I finished, I used an electric buffer on the table with wax. Beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Lolita Wike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I have used it for years as ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I have used it for years as a contractor and cabinet maker. I didn't notice that this was 8 ounce though. I had no idea they made a tiny can. You'll get more for nearly the same price if you pay attention to the size. Also, it's my experience that the color has little effect on the finish you are attempting to restore. I've used them all and they all seem to do the same thing regardless of the color
customer_reviews.author: Chip P.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the miracle product I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I have this very nice dark wood table that I got from Jordan's Furniture about 10 years ago. So the table is really old and worned out. It has water rings and scratches. The product definitely improved the appareance of the table, it darkened the trouble spots and it made the wood shinier, but didn't completely cover the marks and scratches like I saw in some examples here. I guess I was hoping for a miracle. I still recommend it to fix minor issues, though.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: The best product that I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: After 10 years of normal daily use, my kitchen cabinets were looking a little rough, especially near the sink where water splashes had left white marks. I thought that I was going to have to have my cabinets refinished in order to restore their original look. No, no, no!!! Restor a Finish removed those marks, and my cabinets look like new. No kidding! The picture on the front of the can is not an exaggeration, and it took no elbow grease at all - just wiped it on! I have never been so happy with a product before! I finished it off with the recommended Feed N Wax, and now water just beads up instead of further damaging the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Solem

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work for Heat Rings
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find that it worked and it ruined the finish. Didn't do a thing for the heat ring on my table. That wasn't the worst part I used 0000 steel wool and it ruined the finish. Just donated the table and chairs to a local charity.
customer_reviews.author: MrsFontenot

customer_reviews.title: Economic quick decent finish
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this for close to cherry brown table because I wanted to darken it a bit. Cleaned the surface up with a mixture of all purpose cleaner and vinegar. Though I rubbed it dry after applying. After some time I started seeing some spots. Sprayed some vinegar and wiped again. And got rid of them. But they appeared again. Not sure why. Will try putting another quote. And revise this review. I tried the putting some over a light oak colored dresser. Regret it as this has darkened some of the scratches making them more visible. That's my bad though. The product is advised for respective colors only.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Odd that Cherry Color Sold In Smaller Can
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but minus one star for being so expensive in a smaller than normal container. Why is the cherry stain color in a smaller can for the same price as the Maple?????
customer_reviews.author: Jaimslaw

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled on this when getting my house ready to sell; the 1980s honey oak kitchen cabinets looked pretty sad and replacing them would have cost a fortune. One can of this amazing product probably got me an extra $10,000 on the sale price because the cabinets, while not new, looked great. There is no strong odor, but you can smell it when you're using it, just like when you paint the walls. Just bought three more shades to use in my new house for the woodwork and for furniture--including two antique desks. This stuff is beyond expectations. Just remember to wear rubber gloves so you don't stain your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed in product
customer_reviews.text: I bought it a while ago and just now have had a chance to try it due to moving into a new home and all that goes with doing that. Very Disappointed in this product. Did not do what it claimed to do. I would not give it any stars but I could not complete this review without giving it something. I recommend it. Rarely does something I purchase on amazon disappoint me but this did.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product didn't do what it was supposed to. I followed the directions, exactly, but it did not incorporate the new finish with the old. It was basically putting stain over the old finish. It also didn't help with scratches although it did get rid of a few water rings (the white ones, the black ones it doesn't help with). Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do anything for me...
customer_reviews.text: At first it left a nice sheen on the table and maybe, mildly, hid a few scratches, certainly not all. Let it dry the recommended time, gave it a wipe down per instructions and if it did anything it may have evened out the finish on the table, but the scratches, which are not very deep, it did nothing for. So it didn't cause anymore problems and was a quick procedure, but for me, it didn't solve anything on the finish of the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Family est. 2006Top Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Instructions if you need them, not the back of the can.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend, it’s an easy product to use. Clean/dust the cabinetry or piece of furniture. Use 0000 stainless steel to lightly sand. Clean off the sanding dust. Dab some of this on a cotton rag and wipe on. A little goes a long way, just make sure the color matches close-ish, it’s not dark but it can alter color a bit. Let sit for 20 minutes to dry like on the can. I usually do a layer of feed & wax, gloop on and let sit 20-30 minutes, wipe off with cotton rag and polish with microfiber cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit902

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, ok but nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite what is advertised. Reminds me of the concoction of paint thinner and stain my grandpa always used to touch up old furniture. It evaporates rather quickly and takes quite a bit to actually do the job. Doesn’t work on all finishes, does not penetrate all woods, and will destroy a glossy finish. In my opinion a little stain or wood dye for wood that rejects stain is far more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn C Melia

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the many favorable reviews. I used it hoping to spruce up my kitchen cabinets. I followed the directions and am very disappointed with the results. I see no difference in the look of my cabinets. Old English or Pledge do a much better job. Plus it has a strong chemical smell. I tried to return it but it is considered a toxic material and can’t be shipped back.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit of elbow grease and a few coats to cover the white spots on my new Amish trestle table but I finally got them out (water rings). Didn’t know they weren’t treated and let the kids put cups on it. After finally getting them out and then coating with bees wax advertised with this product the table looks good. I now cover with plastic throwaway tablecloth when the grandkids come!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product to clean up some scratches and where marks on our bed and a couple of doors. After following the directions exactly, we saw that this product did absolutely nothing to cover or repair the damage. The item is non-returnable but through Amazon customer service we were able to obtain a refund. Excellent service from Amazon, very poor quality from Howard’s.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: The tabletop looked better than before the application but did not restore the ...
customer_reviews.text: The product did not cover the lighter chipped areas on my kitchen table. The tabletop looked better than before the application but did not restore the table like in the promotional videos. Also, this purchase was not a good value, I purchased the small 8oz. can. Yesterday I saw the 16oz. can at a big box store at a much lower price that what I paid for this small 8oz. can.
customer_reviews.author: LisaO

customer_reviews.title: The proof is in the pics!
customer_reviews.text: I got the Neutral color because I also have wooden blinds, bar stools, and various other pieces that could use some restoring. I thought my kitchen cabinets were fine, but wiped them down anyway, and wow, the luster is just beautiful. Best of all, it's super easy. You don't even have to clean them beforehand, unless they're really bad. I ended up doing all my kitchen cabinets, two bath vanities, three bar stools, one pool table, some window blinds and a storage trunk, and probably used only 1/4 of the 16 oz. can at most.
customer_reviews.author: Alice WakefieldTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Saved my dining room table!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see if it would be able to fix some very large deep white heat marks on my dining room table, and I am SHOCKED at how well it worked. The table looks brand new! I used it with very fine steel wool like it suggests, and it took me maybe 20 minutes of rubbing it in the damaged areas and swiping over the rest of the top. Finished with the Feed & Wax. Whole thing took less and an hour, and it looks phenomenal! Keep a window open for the fumes. If you are on the fence, I can't recommend this product highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: Lynx

customer_reviews.title: You gotta get the color right
customer_reviews.text: My kitchen cabinets are a warm honey maple, very natural color. I first bought the "Maple-Pine" color, thinking no problem, it's got maple in the name. Wrong. The color was way off and actually made the water stains look worse. So I bought the "Natural" and my water stains almost disappeared. Unfortunately, the seller does not take returns, so whatever you buy is yours forever. You may need to try a couple of different colors before you find the right one, but it's worth it when it's right. I was going to have to refinish all of my cabinets, and now I don't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Webfan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I will have to let the picture speak for themselves. I purchased 3 colors a while back (including cherry) but could only find the Maple-Pine color. I figured I’d just try it out and see if it made any difference. Holy cow. We did our antique china cabinet that has tons of scratches. It’s like it erased the majority of them. Then I decided to swipe my damp microfiber cloth over our weather-worn front door. Amazing results!! All of this was done with the Maple Pine color. We may go over it once I find my can of Cherry.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the m our amazing product ever. I have a dining table that belonged to my grandparents and is very sentimental. It has been beat up over the last few years by my kids and husband and I tried everything. It has this horrible cloudy white heat marks on it and I was skeptical because some people said it didn't work to get them out. It does take a LOT of elbow grease. I went over it again and again but it did the trick. It even made an improvement on the legs that were chewed on years ago by a dog. This is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: PGS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Incredible  Product
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I did not take before photos. I had very aggressively cleaned my kitchen cabinets. I felt they were ruined. As I was considering selling my house a local realtor told me nobody wants cherry cabinets (I love them) so I contacted local cabinet painters to possibly repaint them. I came across this product and read the reviews. I felt it was worth a try. What did I have to lose? My cabinets look brand new. This is an amazing product. Many thanks to the reviewers who were right on point. Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is freaking magic! I had two pieces of furniture that had old water marks on them. I had tried other methods to improve the appearance to no avail. I wasn't really expecting much but read reviews and watched videos for this product and decided to give it a try. The marks completely disappeared from one piece and on the other are 75% improved in appearance. I'm surprised and impressed!
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this working. So for the heck of it I bought it. Being disabled I can not do too much but this sounded easy enough. You just wipe it on and let it dry and you can add a second coat if needed. My wooden kitchen cabinets needed it badly around the door pulls from wear. I did as directed and WOW you can not see the wear anymore. It restored the finish in those areas I did the same on my bath wooden cabinets and it restored those areas too. I highly recommend this product. I love it and I hardly used much at all.
customer_reviews.author: mms.crazy

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I used bleach, toothpaste and vinegar to try to remove a dark stain from our hardwood floor. I know! Huge mistake as I have the original stain and now also a big white spot. I used this and Restore did indeed bring back the original color of the floor! Amazing. Follow directions. It is an amazing product and was recommended to us by a friend who seems to know how to fix everything--except dark stains on hardwood, : ). You will like this product.
customer_reviews.author: net shopper

customer_reviews.title: When you don't want to completely refinish...
customer_reviews.text: I like finding antique pieces that just need a little love, not a complete refinishing job. The Restor-A-Finish fits the bill. The stain in it is very minimal so even if it doesn't exactly match, it works. There is one before photo and two after photos of a little dresser that I recently brought back to life. A friend gave me a little bit of the Howard Product orange beeswax and I'm going to get a stash of that as well. There is a smell, but not as bad as full-blown stain or varnish. I was working in my living room on this and just had the windows open. It dries pretty quickly and the smell does not linger.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan K

customer_reviews.title: Works Near-Miracles (as Promised)
customer_reviews.text: I have had a difficult time getting my wife to accept that coffeemakers emit steam and can damage cabinets directly above them. Thus, a large portion of the front of some of our maple cabinets had badly "bleached out" sections. I had used this product in the past in a dark shade and had success with it. I did not know how well it would work on light wood like maple. Answer: Marvelously! Two applications with 0000 steel wool virtually eliminated the defective areas and they look new. Could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used both natural and darker colors of this product and it works unbelievably well. It covers most scuffs and scratches and does a incredible job of covering faded finishes up in places like under kitchen or bathroom sinks where water has bleached out the color. Just wipe it on with a rag and follow up with a dry rag to remove any excess. It is a super fast process and makes most cabinets look like new.
customer_reviews.author: cwd777

customer_reviews.title: Bought the oil polish (orange and lemon), the soap, rinse and this stuff.  Its bringing old furniture back to life.  Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought a number of Howard products the same day and they are all amazing. I have some furniture I inherited from my grandfather and it has brought them all back to life. We bought an old turntable off Facebook Marketplace and it, like many things of the 50's/60's had a pretty heavy smoking smell. A few applications of the soap and oil polish and its almost like new. I recommend this stuff to anyone working with wood. Using this restor a finish now on a table we picked up.
customer_reviews.author: The Brady Report

customer_reviews.title: did what it was supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest i didn't think this would work for my situation. But it did. On my hardwood flooring, I has some paint spatters from painting the walls that had dried. I used paint stripper and it stripped the whole finish and flooring color off, leaving huge rigid white marks that were very noticeable. This stuff restored the finish and covered the markings up. The floor looks great :)
customer_reviews.author: Kalin Alvey

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a few colors for different wood grains and tones around the house. I used the Cherry and it worked perfectly on scratches on my hardwood floors except I used Cherry and it was darker than I thought. I wish they had a color to match my Brazilian redwood. So now the scratches are noticeable. But that was my fault for not testing it first. I have already used this product for many things. I bought Cherry, Neutral and honey oak. Will look for smaller bottles next time because this stuff goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Who knew?
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to us by an antique dealer and we are very happy with this and what it has done to our cherry antique dining table. I didn't know anything about the product before this. We use type 0000 steel wool first and then the restorer, that ended up being a great tip from a professional. The odor is not awful. Table looks good as new and it also took care of two water marks, one made by a painter who put her water bottle down on the table and before we could kill her, it made a mark. We buried her in the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is actually like an as seen on TV products, that works like it shows for once. I have a large double oak door for a front door with a walnut stain finish. My dogs had scratched at the front door and plus we have additional scratches from daily use. I poured this product onto a paper towel, rubbed it over the scratches 1 time. Gone. All evidence of scratches, gone. I wish I had done a before and after because I was stunned by how it absolutely covered any evidence of a previous scratch! With this product, you will never have to re-stain anything due to scuffs or scratches!
customer_reviews.author: 2tonCrain

customer_reviews.title: A great cabinet pick-me-up
customer_reviews.text: Great product, did exactly what I was looking for. Not a stain product, it’s not going to change the color of the wood. It does do a great job of getting rid of any water marks and hide any sort of peeling finish. I found that when using a slightly darker tone (walnut) on my lighter wood (didn’t really find a tone that matched the orange-y/dark honey color we had) I found that it slightly darkened only the wood grain lines, but did a wonderful job of adding a rich, healthy tone to the rest of the cabinet. It really breathed some life back into these cabinets in my rental house, without changing the original look.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy

customer_reviews.title: Works but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: It's a light finisher that worked okay on my table at restoring color but it isn't very strong. It also isn't very permanent, as soon as you wipe it off (and you'll want to wipe it off since it smells like gasoline and will stain whatever it touches) it'll go away, and on the can it says that you need to buy another one of their products (a wax finisher) to keep it on there. I felt that was a bit deceptive but it's fine I suppose since that's on me for my lack of knowledge about restoring old wood.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cho

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! Works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing!!! I was going to refinish the cabinets and bought this on a whim. It works! It makes my cabinets look beautiful. I went around the whole house and did the baseboards, bathroom cabinets and kitchen cabinets along with the staircase. The color matches perfect too. My father-in-law was impressed too. He is a carpenter. The smell is strong. I wore a mask, gloves and open all the windows in the house. Next day smell was gone.
customer_reviews.author: HWStyle

customer_reviews.title: this purchase was not a good value, I purchased the small 8oz
customer_reviews.text: The espresso finish on some of my kitchen cabinets has worn off on the edges. The Ebony Restor-a-Finish did not penetrate into the wood to cover the light edges on the cabinet doors. I had cleaned/prepped the surface per the directions. Also, this purchase was not a good value, I purchased the small 8oz. can. Yesterday I saw the 16oz. can at a big box store at a much lower price that what I paid for this small 8oz. can.
customer_reviews.author: LisaO

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well on my table. I had to go over it twice in some spots but it definitely made a difference. Unfortunately- probably because we use it all the time (which is why it was in need of this stuff to begin with) - it didn’t last more than 2 weeks. I am going to keep using it though because it definitely made it look better for a while. Until we can find another table to take its place we can keep this one looking half way decent with this.
customer_reviews.author: JAMC

customer_reviews.title: Oily after
customer_reviews.text: It's an improvement for sure, but it's a LOT of work if you have bleached out white ring areas as all these areas will turn dark. Also leaves an oily residue behind that is a PIA to deal with as it continues to give off a slick oily film and touch on/to everything. Holy Grail it's not, but it works good enough to warrant the small cost, just expect little from it before use and you'll be pretty pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Richards

customer_reviews.title: Refinish your wood cabinets and make them look like new
customer_reviews.text: This product is GREAT. I have used this to restore two rental kitchen cabinets using noting but gloves, 0000 steel wool, this stuff and a little elbow grease ... made the cabinets look like new (and then I just topped them of with spray shellac to seal and give a lasting shine). Saved $1000's over new cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Ted in Cal

customer_reviews.title: Really restores the finish.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kitchen cabinets. We used vinegar to wipe them down then coated them with restore a finish. I used A microfiber cloth then went back with a super fine pad of steel wool. One more wipe with the cloth and its done. The odor isn't too bad and it just couldn't be easier. I cannot believe I almost stripped my cabinets to restain them. Im very glad I found this. They are 20 years old and I just love the golden oak color. I have successfully preserved my kitchen cabinets. Next we are going to add wax to seal them.
customer_reviews.author: TheHappylittlelady

customer_reviews.title: It do t work don't waste your time and money fake reviews

No trust in review's any more only word of mouth!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff
customer_reviews.text: After reading recommendations and watching videos on using this product, I decided to give it a try. We had purchased an old heavy framed mirror that was in rough shape. It was badly scraped, nicked and scratched. Applying Restor-A-Finish per the directions restored this piece to a lovely antique, and I was impressed. We also used it on a a small cabinet that was in poor condition and I was equally amazed with those results. I will continue to use this product and give it two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Dbrit

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Omg!!! I could not believe how well this product worked. I was handed down a cool mid century modern dining table from my grandma, but it was in BAD shape. The thought of refinishing was daunting, so I tried this hoping it would work and it looks amazing! I used a fine steel wool pad to apply which buffed out some of the slight imperfections. Otherwise, absolutely NO prep. I can’t recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a permanent fix
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as a permanent restore. I followed the instructions to the letter and after about a month the finish on my oak table needs Restored again. So it isn't permanent. I give it 3 stars because the product did a nice temporary job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Darker than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed after using this on a portion of my kitchen cabinets. The color was a bit too dark where some of the finish has worn to bare wood. I watched video upon video on this stuff and really though it would help my cabinets a bit more. I even used 0000 wool. They look somewhat better than they did, but they mostly look oily instead of flaky and dry. It seems my cabinets may have to be sanded and re-stained, which was what I wanted to avoid for a little while longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AMAZING! We moved into a rental house with cabinets that have lots of scratches. I knew there had to be a way to make them look better. I was about to order a stain pen when I came across this product. I just rubbed it in with a soft cloth and used a small, natural-bristle paintbrush to get in all the grooves. I probably needed to use the steel wool on the deeper scratches, but, for a rental, I think I did the homeowner a huge favor. I can't wait to do the kitchen cabinets!
customer_reviews.author: coradj76

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I always thought that the only way to correct scratches and imperfection foubd in wood's finishing was to "sand and refinish" (too much work when you're talking an entire home's trim). I watch a few YouTube video's on how to refinish trims and came around this product. I'm so glad I did! I tried in a few inconspicuous areas and was really pleased with the results. Its masks regular "wear and tear" nicely. It gives shine and cover scratches with color, making it hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: My Wood Looks Like New!
customer_reviews.text: House Restore-A-Finish is an excellent product to make wood finishes on furniture or wood trim look like new. The color in the product hides scratches and the oil shines the wood. I used this in our RV on the midtown cherry throughout. It did a great job cleaning, hiding scratches and adding lustre. I applied it with cotton flannel. It goes on easily. I have it 4 stars for odor because it does have an odor initially, but it dissipates in a few hours. It’s an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a little tlc
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on vintage furniture that just needed a little TLC and the furniture looks fantastic now. I'm talking minor water stains, some scratches...1940's furniture in good condition already, but not mint condition. Then, I used it on a piece that should probably be stripped and restained and it looks a little less scratched, but no miracle. So, it works miracles if the piece has normal wear, but no miracle if the piece is really beat up.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not the magic bullet, but good.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my giant double 10’ front doors. The doors has never been protected since install 7 years ago, and it really showed. The bottom 3-4’ where the sun beat down on them was in pretty rough shape. Here’s the deal: this stuff improved the door look, but definitely do not expect it to be a magic bullet. If the door is rough, this isn’t going to help that at all. In the end; this is a nice bandaid for my door before I end up having to remove, sand, and stain it.
customer_reviews.author: M&ROlsen

customer_reviews.title: Great for pick me up on old cabinets

It’s smelly, but not too bad, I use gloves to apply with an old rag. After a month, the cabinets still look pretty decent for as old and beat up as they are.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best. Thing. Ever.

We bought an expensive dining table from West Elm and within months started getting white spots that looked like stripped paint spots. We were super upset and pretty much resigned to the fact that we were stuck with these ugly spots. Within seconds, this table has been restored to its original glory. I wish I had more spots to fix because I’m so amazed. Also, a little goes such a long way.
customer_reviews.author: KKNYC

customer_reviews.title: It works Great

customer_reviews.author: Ruth Burnside

customer_reviews.title: Try it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stuff! I was going to strip my antique table because it was full of scratches. The transformation was incredible and took me maybe 30min on an 8' table. I used the mahogany. I think the cloth works great. I did have to use 0000 steel wool on some areas, and though it improved those area, I can see scratches from the wool in certain lighting. I easily took 10 years off my cabinets with almost no work. Wipe on, wait 30 min, wipe off. I do think i should have gotten a lighter bottle as the golden oak took too well in some scuff marks and made them dark... but overall still very pleased. Used half the bottle on my entire kitchen. Will update review if product doesn't hold up.

customer_reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect much. My vanity was looking very worn and I was thinking of painting or replacing it. I saw this product and figured it was worth a shot. I could always paint or replace the vanity if this was a bust. It was anything but a bust. The vanity looks almost new. It was easy to apply. I had the entire double sink vanity done in less than an hour. I am very happy to review this product. It has earned a five star review in my opinion.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get the hype.
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the good reviews I was really excited to try this. Not happy. It does not fix water rings and scratches like it claims. Doesn’t even diminish them. On my one table I think it even accented steam marks. The only thing it does is add a nice gloss. I tried it on an old end table that had no scratches or scratches and it did make it look newer. For furniture that has scratches etc use varathune stain plus poly. It takes requires some light sanding but results are much better.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Vogel

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this product, but didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product, but didn't feel it really covered any scratches or blemishes in the areas I tried the product. I used the product on my dining room table and on entertainment center. It does seem to leave a shine on the wood. Overall, it may not have been the product I was searching for.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Easy for the DIY
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my solid wood front door (sheltered n/nw exposure). It hadn’t been refinished in at least 11 years and I wanted to do this myself. I did pre-clean the door prior to use since it was dirty. This product was super easy to use, wipe on, wipe off excess wait and seal. Took me about 2.5 hrs to do the door and side lights all in. As long as it wears well, I’m very happy with how it looks today! Pictures are before, after “Restore a Finish” coat and finally after “Howard Products Wood Polish & Conditioner”
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: A miracle and a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: After 20 years of only sweeping & Murphy's Oil Soap mopping, my parquet flooring in the Living Room, Dining Room and Hallway was dull, greyish and not at all as beautiful as it was originally. Naturally, not much to do about life's wear & tear, but the Howard's products worked a miiracle! It took 1 1/2 cans of the Restore-A-Finish to do ALL of the pictured floors and only ONE bottle of the Feed & Wax! The worst part of the job was the edge-to-edge supercleaning, prior to using these products. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Christiarc

customer_reviews.title: Great product for scratches! Don't forget steel wool
customer_reviews.text: Seriously good! I purchased dark walnut to use on our badly scratched wood veneer table. We had some minor scratches, major scratches and gouges :( I applied w/ steel wool and found that working it into the deeper scratches required going against the grain to fill the depression. I then wiped and buffed everything out as it does leave a bit of residue. There were a couple of huge gouges that didn't fully get covered but overall I couldn't be happier with the results! Saved $$$ from having to buy a new table.

product_meta.title: Howard Products RF3016 Restor-A-Finish, 16 oz, Golden Oak
product_meta.description:
Size Name:16 oz| Color:Golden OakIn 1969, Douglas G. Howard set out to solve this dilemma: how can you eliminate blemishes in wood finishes and restore the original color and luster without removing any of the existing finish? Unable to find an answer at his local hardware store, he went to work in his garage to create his own product. His goal was to make something that would be much more than a surface treatment, yet nothing like a stripper or a refinisher. The key was to develop a formula that could clean and polish the surface, penetrate the finish with stain, and leave the original finish intact. The end result was Restor-A-Finish, Doug Howard's first in what would become a complete line of wood care products. For over 40 years, Howard's Restor-A-Finish has been a standard in the antique industry. Because Restor-A-Finish preserves the original wood finish it also helps preserve its authenticity and value, whereas stripping the finish may literally strip the piece of its value. Almost any existing wood tone, from a Birdseye Maple to a Jacobean, can be closely matched using one of the nine available finish colors. Trying it on just about everything with a traditional wood finish, antique dealers, refinishers, and homemakers have found it to be a safer and easier alternative to stripping and refinishing. Scratches, oxidation, white heat rings, watermarks, smoke damage, and sun fade simply disappear.
